title: Ian Verrender fact checks Donald Trump's claims on the economy and tariffs | The Business | ABC NEWS
description: During the longest State of the Union address on record, US President Donald Trump boasted that the stock market is booming, inflation is coming down, wages are heading up, and America is in a golden age.  But is the American economy as strong as Donald trump says it is?   ABC's chief business correspondent Ian Verrender sits down with Kirsten Aiken to discuss the US President's claims about the economy.  Ian Verrender says the American economy has been performing quite well for some time, but largely because of the amount of investment in artificial intelligence and data centres.  "Of course, the whole boom in artificial investment and data centers has driven Wall Street for quite some time. That does seem to be coming to an end, though.  There's a lot of investors who are really quite lacking confidence in the future," he tells The Business.  He says in the past six months or so, around about $75 billion worth of US investors has been money flowing out of the country, and about $25 billion of that was since the start of this year. #ABCBusiness Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: 'ISIS bride' was 14 when she married a terrorist, sister says | ABC NEWS
description: The sister of an Australian woman who is stuck in the Al-Roj detention camp in Syria has revealed how her sister was "groomed" into travelling to a war zone. Kirsty Rosse-Emile is one of 34 women and children with links to the Islamic State terrorist group who are trying to return home to Australia. title: "Doesn't stack up": Laura Tingle on Trump's State of the Union speech | ABC NEWS
description: Donald Trump has addressed US Congress in the annual State of the Union speech, touting his administration's economic and immigration policies. Global Affairs Editor Laura Tingle says the speech was an opportunity for the US president to restore his dwindling popularity in the polls, but doubts his 'excessive' hyperbolic language can cut through to the American people. title: The Lodge evacuated after major security threat against the prime minister | ABC NEWS
description: A Chinese dance troupe performing in Australia has been linked to a bomb threat that forced the prime minister to evacuate The Lodge. The group, which is banned in China, alerted police after receiving an email with threats against Anthony Albanese. It follows a similar threat made against the Gold Coast venue where the dancers are performing. National Affairs Correspondent Jane Norman reports. title: Police video of arrests related to kidnapped grandfather Chris Baghsarian | ABC NEWS
description: Two men have been arrested by tactical officers in Sydney's north-west in relation to the alleged kidnapping and murder of grandfather Chris Baghsarian. Forensic testing has officially confirmed human remains found dumped in Pitt Town belong to the 85-year-old, who was taken hostage in what police say was a case of mistaken identity linked to organised crime networks. title: Albanese asked to ‘urgently rescind’ appointment of NT administrator | ABC NEWS
description: Northern Territory politicians and community group representatives have delivered an open letter to the Prime Minister, asking him to "urgently rescind" the appointment of controversial incoming administrator David Connolly. title: Citizen scientists discover huge coral colony on Great Barrier Reef | ABC NEWS
description: Mother-daughter duo Jan Pope and Sophie Kalkowski-Pope have described the breathtaking moment they discovered a large, rolling field of coral on the Great Barrier Reef. The pair were involved in a citizen science effort called The Great Reef Census when they came upon what could be one of the largest coral colonies ever documented on the reef. title: Iranian students hold fresh round of anti-government protests | The World | ABC NEWS
description: While Washington and Tehran are set to meet for a third round of nuclear talks this week, the situation on the ground in Iran remains unstable.  The regime has continued its brutal crackdown on protestors, with human rights groups documenting cases of arbitrary detention, abductions, and torture.   At least 30 people are at risk of the death penalty, however Nikita White from Amnesty International Australia says the number is likely to be much higher.   #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: "Gloves are off" with UK parliament voting to release Andrew documents | The World | ABC NEWS
description: UK Parliament has voted to release documents relating to former Prince Andrew's appointment as trade envoy between 2001 and 2011.   Cultural historian Dr Cindy McCreery says it shows Britain has entered a new era of "transparency and accountability" with the Royal family.   British MPs broke parliamentary convention to criticise the former prince, who was arrested last week on suspicion of misconduct in public office amid claims he shared confidential government information with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.   Dr McCreery told The World's Yvonne Yong that Westminster was "open slather" against Andrew.
